result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Albert Sullivan Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 3:34 Defendant Jeffrey Albert Sullivan in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing on Defendant's request to stay jail time.  Mr Sullivan wishes to wait until  October or later to start his jail time. Froelich objects without a letter from doctor.  Court: Def should talk to Sheriff to discuss the medical conditions to determine if the jail is able to handle his conditions. If the PCSO doesn't get back to the Court, Def must report in 2 days. If the PCJ doesn't want Mr Sullivan, the Court will determine.
Hearing on June 12, 2017 at 03:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: 11:17 Defendant Jeffrey Albert Sullivan in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing based on request by Defendant asking his jail sentence stayed longer. Def provides letter from doctor with surgery date. Atty Froelich does not object to staying the jail time. Court: requested is granted. Jail will start February 12, 2017 at 7pm, huber allowed. Release date will be March 3, 2017

8:41  Defendant Jeffrey Albert Sullivan in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich files amended information of Misd Theft 1 count  plead to that charge 1 yr probation and 45 days conditional jail    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the amended charge of Misd Theft  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the charge of Misdemeanor Theft in the amended information.  Court orders S/W Probation 1 year. Conditions:   21 days condtional jail stayed until Nov 18, 2016 at 7:00 PM  Huber is allowed.  Court costs DNA sample and SC. Comply with any conditions the probation agent imposes.   Appeal Rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing at 04-25-2016 08:30 am.
